Name: Comb of ivory
Description: This comb of ivory comes from the excavations of W. F. Petrie at Naqada in 1895. It is characterised by the long teeth of which two were probably already worn out at the moment when the object was deposited in the tomb. The upper part originally carried a decorative motif in the form of an animal, like a bird, or in the form of part of an animal, like the horns of a bull.
